byline.original: By JEFF ZELENY and MONICA DAVEY

abstract: Pres Obama arrives in Michigan on yet another visit to argue that his decision to bail out two of the Big Three automakers helped workers across industrial Midwest; Obama, who has returned to state nine times since taking office, has offered up rebuttal to criticism of value of government intervention; Democrats believe Obama cannot win re-election without winning Michigan.
snippet: President Obama has returned to Michigan again and again to argue that his decision to bail out two of the Big Three automakers helped workers across the industrial Midwest.
lead_paragraph: President Obama has returned to Michigan again and again to argue that his decision to bail out two of the Big Three automakers helped workers across the industrial Midwest.

headline.main: In Michigan, Obama Seeks Some Mileage Out of Auto Bailout
headline.print_headline: In Auto State, Obama Looks for Bailout Mileage
headline.seo: Obama Visits Michigan as Auto Jobs Come Back
